meanings.definition: Have as belonging to one; own.
meanings.sent3: The cat posses the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: He posses a heart full of kindness.
meanings.sent5: The old house posses a mysterious aura.

meanings.definition: To have as a characteristic, quality, or attribute.
meanings.sent1: Her smile posses a warmth that comforts everyone.
meanings.sent2: His paintings posses a unique style.
meanings.sent3: The puppy posses a mischievous spirit.
meanings.sent4: The song posses a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The garden posses a riot of colors.

meanings.definition: To be in control of; have at one's disposal.
meanings.sent1: She posses the key to the treasure chest.
meanings.sent2: He posses the power to make decisions.
meanings.sent3: The magician posses a bag of endless tricks.
meanings.sent4: The chef posses the secret recipe.
meanings.sent5: The captain posses the ship's wheel with confidence.

meanings.definition: To be capable of; have the ability to.
meanings.sent1: She posses the skill to play the piano beautifully.
meanings.sent2: He posses the knowledge to solve complex problems.
meanings.sent3: The superhero posses the strength to lift cars.
meanings.sent4: The scientist posses the intellect to discover new theories.
meanings.sent5: The athlete posses the speed to win races.
